metadata.feature_description: Basic UI structure and navigation for URL management module

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > SEO in Persona Bar
steps.expected: SEO settings panel opens with URL Management tab
steps.actual: SEO panel opened successfully showing URL Management and Sitemap Settings tabs

steps.expected: URL Rewriter and URL Redirects settings are displayed with proper controls
steps.actual: GENERAL SETTINGS tab displays URL REWRITER section (Standard Replacement Character, Concatenate Page URLs, Convert URLs to Lowercase, etc.) and URL REDIRECTS section (Redirect deleted pages, Redirect to Friendly URLs, etc.)

steps.action: Click on EXTENSION URL PROVIDERS tab
steps.expected: Extension URL Providers tab content loads
steps.actual: Tab switched successfully showing 2 extension providers: Evoq Content Item Url Extension Provider and Evoq Structured Content Visualizer Url Extension Provider (both enabled)

steps.expected: TEST URL tab content loads with testing form
steps.actual: Tab switched successfully showing TEST A PAGE URL section (Page to Test, Query String, Custom Page Name fields) and TEST URL REWRITING section (URL to Test, Rewriting Result, Identified Language, etc.)

steps.action: Click on Sitemap Settings main tab
steps.actual: Tab switched successfully showing GENERAL SITEMAP SETTINGS (Sitemap URL, caching, priority settings), SITEMAP PROVIDERS list (8 providers), and SITE SUBMISSION section

steps.action: Observe UI elements during tab navigation
steps.expected: All tabs load without errors, content is properly displayed
steps.actual: All tabs loaded correctly with proper layout, dropdowns, toggles, and buttons displayed as expected. No JavaScript errors observed in navigation.

observations: URL Management is located under Settings > SEO in the Persona Bar, not under Site Behavior as the manifest file (Evoq.PersonaBar.UrlManagement.dnn) indicates with menu='SiteBehavior'. The actual UI path is: Persona Bar > Settings > SEO > URL Management

The code files (urlmanagement.html and urlmanagement.js) in the repository contain stub/placeholder content ('Hello World, This is Url Management') but the actual deployed module has full functionality - indicating the production build uses different source files or the stub files are outdated
EXPRESSIONS tab has a blue icon/indicator next to it, suggesting it may have special functionality or notifications
